title: E2E test: agent credits account and views transactions
description: Write an e2e test where an agent registers, gets a bank account, receives a credit, and views transaction history. Uses existing IdentityMixin and BankMixin. Test: register → platform creates account → platform credits funds → agent.get_balance() verifies updated balance → agent.get_transactions() verifies credit entry appears.

title: E2E test: economic cycle - earn then spend
description: Write an e2e test demonstrating a full economic cycle where an agent earns money then uses it. Requires TaskBoardMixin + BankMixin. Test: register agent A + agent B → fund agent A → A posts task → B bids → A accepts → B submits → A approves → verify B earned reward → B posts a NEW task using earned funds → A bids on B's task → verify full circular fund flow.

title: Decompose TaskManager god class (2108 lines) into focused services
description: The TaskManager class in services/task-board/src/task_board_service/services/task_manager.py is a 2108-line god class with 25+ public methods spanning 6+ concerns: task CRUD, deadline evaluation/transitions, escrow management with retry logic, asset file storage, JWS token validation, database schema initialization, statistics, and file path security. This violates SRP (6 reasons to change), DIP (concrete client dependencies, hardcoded sqlite3.connect), ISP (all consumers get the full class), and OCP (adding new task statuses requires modifying deadline evaluation). Decompose into: TaskLifecycleService, DeadlineEvaluator, EscrowCoordinator, AssetManager, TokenValidator, and TaskRepository. Define protocols (AuthVerifier, EscrowClient, Signer) for external dependencies. Extract SQLite access behind a TaskRepository protocol. Also fix duplicated _parse_json_body/_extract_token helpers across routers/tasks.py, routers/bids.py, routers/assets.py, the hardcoded endpoint patterns in middleware.py, and the __setattr__ magic in AppState. Use the Reputation service as the reference for clean layering.

title: Add scenario test infrastructure and first identity scenario test
description: Create agents/tests/scenarios/ directory with conftest.py and test_identity.py. The scenario test starts a BaseAgent, registers it against a live Identity service, then exercises get_agent_info, list_agents, and verify_signature. Requires the identity service running on localhost:8001. Add pytest mark @pytest.mark.scenario. Add just test-scenarios target to agents/justfile (runs pytest tests/scenarios/ -v -m scenario). Add just test-scenarios target to root justfile (delegates to cd agents && just test-scenarios). Scenario tests are NOT part of ci-quiet since they need live services.
close_reason: Scenario test infrastructure added. Identity scenario test passes against live service: register, re-register idempotent, get_agent_info, list_agents, verify_jws.

title: Decompose DisputeService god class (653 lines) into focused services
description: The DisputeService class in services/court/src/court_service/services/dispute_service.py is a 653-line class with 20+ methods mixing persistence (SQLite schema init, raw SQL), dispute lifecycle operations, judge evaluation orchestration, escrow splitting, feedback recording, task ruling, and vote normalization. This violates SRP (multiple reasons to change) and DIP (hardcoded sqlite3.connect in constructor). Additionally, the disputes.py router (~340 lines) has validation helpers (_parse_json_body, _extract_jws_token, _verify_jws) that call get_app_state() internally (service locator anti-pattern), making them hard to test or reuse. Decompose into: DisputeRepository (persistence), DisputeRulingOrchestrator (judge evaluation + side effects), and DisputeValidator (preconditions/state transitions). Extract SQLite access behind a DisputeRepository protocol. Move router validation helpers to accept dependencies as parameters or use FastAPI Depends().

title: Fix log filename: use YYYY-MM-DD.log instead of current.log
description: The active log file is named current.log and only gets renamed to YYYY-MM-DD.log on midnight rotation. The design intent was for log files to always be named YYYY-MM-DD.log. Fix setup_logging() in service-commons to use today's date as the filename directly, so the active log is e.g. 2026-03-01.log from the start.
close_reason: Already fixed - DailyRotatingFileHandler in service-commons names files YYYY-MM-DD.log from creation.

title: E2E test: mutual feedback exchange
description: Write an e2e test for the feedback visibility/sealing mechanism. Requires ReputationMixin + TaskBoardMixin. Test: complete a task (happy path) → poster submits feedback (sealed, invisible) → verify feedback not visible → worker submits feedback → verify BOTH feedback entries now visible (mutual reveal). Also test: single feedback becomes visible after reveal_timeout_seconds.

title: E2E test: file a dispute
description: Write an e2e test where a poster disputes a submission. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → post task → bid → accept → submit deliverable → poster disputes (with claim text) → verify task status DISPUTED.

title: Implement Court service (Phase 4)
description: Implement the Court service following docs/codex-tasks/court-service-implementation/README.md phases 1-10. Tests already exist from Phase 3. The service handles LLM-as-a-Judge dispute resolution, depends on Identity, Task Board, Central Bank, and Reputation services. Must pass just ci-quiet when complete.
close_reason: Court service fully implemented - 129 tests pass, all CI checks pass

title: E2E test: agent creates bank account and checks balance
description: Write an e2e test where an agent registers with Identity, then the platform creates a bank account for the agent, and the agent checks its balance. Uses existing IdentityMixin and BankMixin. Requires a platform agent to call POST /accounts (platform-signed). Test: register → platform creates account → agent.get_balance() → verify balance matches initial amount.

title: Implement CourtMixin: file_claim
description: Implement CourtMixin in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/court.py. Methods: file_claim(task_id, reason). @tool decorated, async, uses JWS signing.

title: Implement BankMixin: get_balance, get_transactions, lock_escrow
description: Implement the BankMixin class in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/bank.py. Methods: get_balance(), get_transactions(), lock_escrow(amount, task_id). All methods use JWS signing via self._sign_jws(). All decorated with @tool. All async.
close_reason: BankMixin was already implemented in a prior session

title: E2E test: competing bidders
description: Write an e2e test with multiple workers bidding on the same task. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + 3 workers → fund poster → post task → all 3 workers bid with different amounts → poster accepts one bid → verify task assigned to correct worker → verify all bids still visible after acceptance → verify non-selected workers can still bid on other tasks.

title: E2E test: sealed bid visibility rules
description: Write an e2e test verifying sealed bid mechanics. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker + observer → post task → worker bids → poster can list bids (auth required, sealed phase) → observer cannot list bids (no auth, 403/401) → poster accepts bid → observer CAN now list bids (public after OPEN phase ends).

title: E2E test: full dispute with court ruling and escrow split
description: Write an e2e test for the complete dispute resolution flow. Requires TaskBoardMixin + CourtMixin + BankMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → post task → bid → accept → submit → poster disputes → worker submits rebuttal → court rules (proportional split, e.g., 60/40) → verify task status RULED → verify escrow split between poster and worker per ruling → verify both agents' balances updated correctly.

title: E2E test: accept a bid and assign worker
description: Write an e2e test for the full bidding flow through acceptance. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → post task → worker bids → poster accepts bid → verify task status is ACCEPTED → verify worker_id is set on task → verify execution deadline is computed.

title: E2E test: post a task with escrow
description: Write an e2e test where a poster agent creates a task that locks funds in escrow. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster → platform creates account → platform credits 1000 → poster posts task (reward=500) → verify task appears in list with status OPEN → verify poster balance decreased by reward amount (escrow locked).

title: Implement ReputationMixin: submit_feedback, get_agent_feedback, get_task_feedback
description: Implement ReputationMixin in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/reputation.py. Methods: submit_feedback(task_id, to_agent_id, category, rating, comment), get_agent_feedback(agent_id), get_task_feedback(task_id). All @tool decorated, all async.

title: E2E test: agent lock escrow fails with insufficient funds
description: Write an e2e test where an agent tries to lock escrow without sufficient funds. Uses existing BankMixin. Test: register → platform creates account with 0 balance → agent.lock_escrow(amount=100, task_id='t-xxx') → verify error response indicates insufficient funds.

title: Implement IdentityMixin: register, get_agent_info, list_agents, verify_signature
description: Implement the IdentityMixin class in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/identity.py. Methods: register() (idempotent - handles 409 by looking up existing agent_id), get_agent_info(agent_id), list_agents(), verify_signature(agent_id, payload, signature). All methods decorated with @tool for Strands compatibility. All async using httpx.
close_reason: Replaced by agent-economy-qy1 with more detailed description based on identity service spec review

title: Implement TaskBoardMixin methods
description: Implement the TaskBoardMixin with methods for the Task Board service (port 8003). Methods needed: post_task(title, description, reward, bidding_deadline_seconds, execution_deadline_seconds, review_deadline_seconds) → creates task with escrow, list_tasks(status, poster_id, worker_id) → lists tasks, get_task(task_id) → gets task details, cancel_task(task_id) → cancels task, submit_bid(task_id, amount) → submits bid, list_bids(task_id) → lists bids, accept_bid(task_id, bid_id) → accepts bid, submit_deliverable(task_id) → submits for review, approve_task(task_id) → approves deliverables, dispute_task(task_id, claim) → disputes deliverables, upload_asset(task_id, filename, content) → uploads file.
close_reason: Implemented all TaskBoardMixin methods: post_task, list_tasks, get_task, cancel_task, submit_bid, list_bids, accept_bid, upload_asset, submit_deliverable, approve_task, dispute_task

title: Implement PlatformAgent and AgentFactory
description: Create AgentFactory class and PlatformAgent subclass with privileged banking operations (create_account, credit_account, release_escrow, split_escrow) and local JWS verification. See docs/plans/2026-03-01-platform-agent-implementation.md
close_reason: PlatformAgent, AgentFactory, and local JWS verification implemented. All 68 tests pass, full CI green.

title: E2E test: post and cancel a task
description: Write an e2e test where a poster creates a task then cancels it. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster → fund account → post task (reward=500) → cancel task → verify task status is CANCELLED → verify poster balance restored (escrow released back).

title: Base agent scaffolding: project structure, config, signing, BaseAgent skeleton
description: Set up agents/ directory with config.yaml, roster.yaml, justfile, pyproject.toml. Implement config.py (Settings class using service-commons pattern), signing.py (Ed25519 key loading/generation/JWS creation), and BaseAgent skeleton class that composes all mixins, holds identity state, and provides _sign_jws/_auth_header/_request internals.
close_reason: Scaffolding complete: pyproject.toml, config.yaml, roster.yaml, justfile, BaseAgent with mixin stubs, signing utilities, config module, and 24 passing unit tests. CI green.

title: E2E test: execution deadline expiry
description: Write an e2e test where a task expires because the worker did not submit before the execution deadline. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → post task with very short execution deadline → worker bids → poster accepts → wait for execution deadline → GET task → verify status EXPIRED → verify escrow released back to poster.

title: E2E test: submit a bid on a task
description: Write an e2e test where a worker bids on an open task. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → poster posts task → worker submits bid → poster lists bids (authenticated, sealed) → verify bid appears with worker's agent_id and amount.

title: Implement TaskBoardMixin: full task lifecycle methods
description: Implement TaskBoardMixin in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/task_board.py. Methods: list_tasks(status?), get_task(task_id), create_task(title, spec, reward, deadlines), cancel_task(task_id), submit_bid(task_id, proposal), list_bids(task_id), accept_bid(task_id, bid_id), upload_asset(task_id, file_path), submit_deliverable(task_id), approve_task(task_id), dispute_task(task_id, reason). All @tool decorated, all async, all use JWS signing where required.
close_reason: Duplicate of kg1, implemented all TaskBoardMixin methods

title: E2E test: happy path - submit deliverable and approve
description: Write an e2e test for the complete happy path from posting through approval. Requires TaskBoardMixin + BankMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund both → poster posts task (reward=500) → worker bids → poster accepts → worker uploads asset → worker submits deliverable → poster approves → verify task status APPROVED → verify worker balance increased by reward → verify poster escrow released to worker.

title: Verify court service uses DailyRotatingFileHandler for logging
description: The shared logging module in service-commons was updated to use DailyRotatingFileHandler instead of TimedRotatingFileHandler with a namer hook. Log files are now named YYYY-MM-DD.log from creation instead of current.log. Once the court service implementation is complete, verify it uses setup_logging() from service-commons (which automatically picks up the new handler) and does not have any custom log file handling that bypasses it.
close_reason: Court service uses setup_logging() from service-commons which has DailyRotatingFileHandler. No custom log handling.

title: Implement ReputationMixin methods
description: Implement the ReputationMixin with methods for the Reputation service (port 8004). Methods needed: submit_feedback(task_id, target_agent_id, category, rating, comment) → submits feedback, get_task_feedback(task_id) → gets all feedback for a task, get_agent_feedback(agent_id) → gets all feedback about an agent.
close_reason: Duplicate of eii, implemented all ReputationMixin methods

title: Implement IdentityMixin: register, get_agent_info, list_agents, verify_signature
description: Implement client methods in agents/src/base_agent/mixins/identity.py that call the Identity service API (port 8001). Methods: register() - POST /agents/register with name and public_key, idempotent (409 means already registered, look up agent_id). get_agent_info(agent_id) - GET /agents/{agent_id}. list_agents() - GET /agents. verify_signature(agent_id, token) - POST /agents/verify. All methods use self._request() / self._request_raw() from BaseAgent and self.config.platform.identity_url for the base URL. Add unit tests in agents/tests/unit/test_identity_mixin.py.
close_reason: IdentityMixin implemented with register, get_agent_info, list_agents, verify_jws. 6 unit tests. CI green.

title: Add rotating file logging to service-commons
description: All 6 services currently log exclusively to stdout via service_commons.logging.setup_logging() (StreamHandler(sys.stdout)). There is no file-based log persistence anywhere. Add a TimedRotatingFileHandler to the shared logging library in libs/service-commons/src/service_commons/logging.py that writes daily rotating log files with YYYY-MM-DD.log naming to each service's data/logs/ folder. Key decisions needed before implementation: (1) file logging in addition to stdout or replacing it, (2) log directory convention (data/logs/ per service vs configurable path vs central folder). Each service's config.yaml logging section will need a new field (e.g. logging.file_path or logging.directory). The per-service logging.py wrappers are identical copy-paste and should not need changes if this is handled in service-commons.
close_reason: Implemented rotating file logging in service-commons with per-service config.yaml directory setting. All 5 implemented services pass CI. Court config.yaml updated for when it's built.

title: Extract database abstractions from business logic in Identity, Task Board, and Court
description: Three of four services (Identity, Task Board, Court) hardcode sqlite3.connect() directly inside business logic classes (AgentRegistry, TaskManager, DisputeService). This violates DIP — business logic is coupled to a specific storage implementation, blocking unit testing without real databases and preventing future migration to PostgreSQL or other backends. For each service: (1) Define a repository protocol/interface in the service layer that describes the persistence operations needed. (2) Move SQLite-specific code into a concrete repository implementation. (3) Inject the repository via constructor in the business logic class. (4) The lifespan (composition root) creates the concrete SQLite repository and injects it. The Reputation service already demonstrates this pattern well with FeedbackStore — use it as the reference. Additionally, for Identity, the AgentRegistry also mixes cryptographic validation and JWS handling with persistence — consider extracting CryptoVerifier and JWSVerifier alongside the AgentRepository.

title: E2E test: auto-approve on review deadline timeout
description: Write an e2e test where a task auto-approves because the poster did not review in time. Requires TaskBoardMixin. Test: register poster + worker → fund poster → post task with very short review deadline → worker bids → poster accepts → worker submits → wait for review deadline to pass → GET task → verify status auto-transitioned to APPROVED → verify escrow released to worker.
